Adds column 'time' to a dataframe containing a timestamp variable.

Source: R/helpers_timestamp.R
add_time.Rd

Adds column 'time' to a dataframe containing a timestamp variable.

add_time(data, utc_col = character(1), tz = "UTC", unit = "s")

Arguments

data

(`dataframe`). A dataframe containing a UTC timestamp variable (in seconds or milliseconds).
utc_col

(`character(1)`). Column name of the UTC timestamp.
tz

(`character(1)`). The timezone. Defaults to using 'UTC'. See as_datetime.
unit

(`character(1)`). The unit of the timestamps. Can be 's' or 'ms'. Defaults to 's' (seconds).

Value

(`dataframe`) with added variable 'time'.

See also

Other helper functions: add_date_time, add_date, add_weekday, calc_feature

  • Arguments
  • Value
